full_text: 1150. EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT Agreement made at New York, N. Y. this 5th day of April , 1967 between K. Ludwig (hereinafter called the "EMPLOYER") and Yung Sing Lo and his wife, Yuk Ying Sum, (hereinafter called the "EMPLOYEES"), In consideration of the premises it is mutually agreed as follows: 1. The EMPLOYER hereby agrees to employ the EMPLOYEES and the EMPLOYEES collective- ly and both together, hereby agree to work for the EMPLOYER, as Domestic Employees, at any residence of the EMPLOYER in the United States and to do and perform any and all work which may be required of them, including but not in limitation thereof, gardening, cooking and any other work which may be required of them. 2. The EMPLOYEES shall be employed for a period of two (2) years beginning from the time both EMPLOYEES arrive in the United States; provided, however, the EMPLOYER shall have the option at any time prior to the end of said two (2) years of employment hereunder, to extend this Agreement and the employment of the EMPLOYEES hereunder, for another period of three (3) years if the services of the EMPLOYEES are satisfactory to the EMPLOYER. If the EMPLOYER elects to extend the employment period by another period of three years, EMPLOYEES shall give EMPLOYER at least six months prior written notice of their intention to leave the employment at the end of the full five year term of their employment. 3. The salary to be paid to the EMPLOYEES (collectively and not severally) for the services they shall perform hereunder shall be as follows: 1st year of employment - $575. per month for both 2nd year of employment - $625. per month for both Said salary shall be paid monthly at the end of each month and for the convenience of the EMPLOYEES and at their request, EMPLOYER hereby agrees to withhold from said salary each month an amount sufficient to pay for their income taxes. 4. The EMPLOYER shall have the unqualified right, for any reason whatsoever, to terminate this Agreement and the services of the EMPLOYEES upon giving the EMPLOYEES fifteen (15) days prior written notice thereof, and at the end of such fifteen (15) days, this Agreement and the services of the EMPLOYEES shall be deemed terminated and at an end, without any liability on the part of the EMPLOYER. In the event the EMPLOYER shall elect to terminate the services of the EMPLOYEES under this Clause 4, the EMPLOYER shall provide the EMPLOYEES such transportation as the EMPLOYER may elect for the return of the EMPLOYEES to Hong Kong; provided, however, if the services of the EMPLOYEES are terminated as a result of the misconduct or failure of the EMPLOYEES to perform their duties in a proper manner, the transportation expenses for the return of the EMPLOYEES to Hong Kong shall be paid by the EMPLOYEES. 5. The EMPLOYER shall advance the cost of transportation to the United States (which may be by plane or vessel, EMPLOYER'S option) and the EMPLOYEES shall reimburse the EMPLOYER for the cost thereof; and the EMPLOYEES hereby authorize the EMPLOYER to deduct the sum of ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS $100. monthly from their salary for the repayment thereof. 6. The EMPLOYEES agree to pruchase a supply of uniforms for a period of three (3) years prior to their departure for the United States. The purchase of the uniforms shall be at the expense of the EMPLOYER and the EMPLOYER agrees to remit to the EMPLOYEES the funds required to purchase the uniforms. 7. The EMPLOYEES agree to file their application for American visas with diligence and depart for the United States promptly after such visas are issued to them. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the EMPLOYER and EMPLOYEES have hereunto signed their names the day and year first above written. EMPLOYER (L.S.) D. K. LUDWIG hail (EMPLOYEES) with (L.S.) YUNG SING LO Signed in the presence of: (L.S.) YUK YING SUM
